page.title: 14SHIRE HORSES IN GOREFIELD
page.content: Wednesday 17th July was a very successful day for{Mr. Graham Ward}of {Decoy Farm, Gorefield.}After suffering from a knee injury the previous evening he recovered well enough to lead one of his mares into the ring at the{East of England Show}held at Peterborough. The Judges were very impressed by the 9 year old bay mare which collected the{Champion Shire {Horse}title. The horse which last won the championship in 1979 has since taken several major titles and is being tipped for further success at the Horse of the Year Show in October. Decoy Royal Surprise won the class for a barren mare or filly aged 3 and over, and went on to take the FW Griffin Challenge Cup and the GT Ward Memorial Cup for the best shire female as well as clinching the championship.
